pullRequest.title: [no ticket][risk=no] Puppeteer e2e test timeout fix

nodes.bodyText: reduces concurrent threads to 2 to deal with flaky tests.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +13,7 @@
     "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",
     "test-staging": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=staging jest --maxWorkers=3",
     "test-staging:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=staging PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=1",
-    "test:ci": "jest --ci --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test:ci": "jest --ci --maxWorkers=2",

nodes.bodyText:
exclude a recently (don't know when) added spinner.

Test failed in https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/all-of-us/workbench/5308/workflows/0b6cbff1-128e-49da-a3d4-d53c4786f7f1/jobs/106906/tests
stacktrace:
FAIL  tests/cohorts/cohorts-create.spec.ts (152.837 s)
  User can create new Cohorts
    ✕ Add Cohort of Physical Measurements BMI (107149 ms)
    ○ skipped Add Cohort of EKG condition with modifiers

  ● User can create new Cohorts › Add Cohort of Physical Measurements BMI

    TimeoutError: waiting for function failed: timeout 90000ms exceeded

      273 | 
      274 |   // Wait for spinners stop and gone.
    > 275 |   await page.waitForFunction((css) => {
          |              ^
      276 |     const elements = document.querySelectorAll(css);
      277 |     return elements && elements.length === 0;
      278 |   }, {polling: 'mutation', timeout: timeOut}, spinElementsSelector);

      at new WaitTask (node_modules/puppeteer/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/DOMWorld.js:394:34)
      at DOMWorld.waitForFunction (node_modules/puppeteer/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/DOMWorld.js:316:16)
      at Frame.waitForFunction (node_modules/puppeteer/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/FrameManager.js:869:32)
      at Page.waitForFunction (node_modules/puppeteer/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/Page.js:1221:33)
      at Object.waitWhileLoading (utils/waits-utils.ts:275:14)
I am ok with this fix in this PR - do we know the upper limit where we want to fail here? Is it at 30s? Or would waiting for the browser default timeout be ok?
I am ok with the change - is it well understood why more max workers causes an issue?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +13,7 @@
     "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",
     "test-staging": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=staging jest --maxWorkers=3",
     "test-staging:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=staging PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=1",
-    "test:ci": "jest --ci --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test:ci": "jest --ci --maxWorkers=2",

nodes.bodyText: 30 seconds is a tryout. hopefully good enough. I don't want to start with a bigger timeout unless it's absolutely necessary. I would think 60 seconds is the upper limit.
